intro: Leveillea martini, commonly known as the Martin's levelling plant, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stems. Due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
